bibl.title: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Frederick F. Russell, [June] 1928

div1.p: Carter discusses her work at the Library of Congress and expresses regret at the death of Noguchi and others working on the eradication of yellow fever throughout the world.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Frederick F. Russell, [June] 1928

opener.dateline:
The Westmoreland,
2122 California St., N. W.
Washington, D. C.
5 May 3, 1928.
opener.add:
date evidently wrong
should be June or July

div1.p:
Just to tell you that the work on the bibliography of the History
is progressing well and that, save for a few books (for which an or-
ganized search is being made at the Library of Congress) I have been
been over practically all of the literature needed for reference in
the Section on Africa of Father's book. Indeed, I took the files for
the Section on the Americas to the Library of Congress on June 1st.
so that Miss Brown and I would have that available to work on while
waiting for the missing books: books that are listed in the Library of
Congress catalogue, but which, it is thought, must have been misplaced
when they were returned to the shelves.

I believe that the Section on Africa, now mainly cleared up, was
our hardest piece of work--not so long as the one on the Americas, but
more difficult to check up and verify. That is why, as I wrote you
before, I thought I'd best get it out of the way first. Also, as
against the length of the Section on the Americas, Miss Brown will
now be able to give me more time, as she finished her other special
work last week.

I can never begin to express how grieved I am about Noguchi's
death. Have you had time to get any details yet? Also I am extremely
sorry about Dr. Young. Surely, its a grim job and up-hill work this
eradication of yellow fever. However, despite all “accidents and losses
of” many of “our best men,” I know that you will continue the work until
it is finisheld:--one of the greatest undertakings of all time! Here's
to you! We're all with you!
div1.closer:
Most truly yours, (Signed) Laura A. Carter. Dr. Frederick F. Russell, Director,
International Health Division,
The Rockefeller Foundation, New York, N.Y.
